text: Even Cowgirls Get the Blues is the third live album by Welsh musician John Cale. It was recorded in 1978 and 1979 in CBGB club in New York. It was released in 1987. The record version contains different track listing than the CD. ==Track listing== ===CD version=== #"Dance of the Seven Veils" #"Helen of Troy" #"Casey at the Bat" #"Even Cowgirls Get the Blues" #"Don't Know Why She Came" #"Somebody Should Have Told Her" #"Decade" #"Magic & Lies" ===LP version=== ;Side A #"Dance of the Seven Veils" #"Helen of Troy" #"Casey at the Bat" #"Even Cowgirls Get the Blues" #"Jack the Ripper at the Moulin Rouge" ;Side B #"Dead or Alive" #"Somebody Should Have Told Her" #"Instrumental for New Years 1980" ("Decade") #"Magic & Lies" #"Memphis" ==Personnel== * John Cale − vocals, guitar, electric piano, viola * Ritchie Fliegler − guitar * Ivan Kral − bass * Bruce Brody − keyboards * Jay Dee Dougherty − drums * Robert Medici − drums * Judy Nylon − vocals ==References== Category:John Cale albums Category:1987 albums
